pullRequest.title: [DOCS] Per-partition categorization
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR updates the machine learning categorization example (https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/machine-learning/master/ml-configuring-categories.html) to include information about per-partition categorization too.
Preview
https://elasticsearch_61506.docs-preview.app.elstc.co/guide/en/machine-learning/master/ml-configuring-categories.html

nodes.bodyText: web access logs do not categorize well so should not use as example - instead try such as logs for different applications
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -98,6 +98,28 @@ to disregard multiple sections of the categorization field value. In this
 example, you might create a filter like `[ "\\[statement:.*\\]"]` to remove the
 SQL statement from the categorization algorithm.
 
+[discrete]
+[[ml-per-partition-categorization]]
+== Per-partition categorization
+
+If you enable per-partition categorization, categories are determined
+independently for each partition. For example, if your data includes messages
+from multiple types of logs (such as access logs and error logs), you can use a
+field like the ECS {ecs-ref}/ecs-event.html[`event.dataset` field] as the 
+`partition_field_name` and categorize the messages for each log separately.

nodes.bodyText:
Could this be a single sentence?
If your job has multiple detectors, every detector that uses the `mlcategory`
keyword must also use the same `partition_field_name`.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -98,6 +98,28 @@ to disregard multiple sections of the categorization field value. In this
 example, you might create a filter like `[ "\\[statement:.*\\]"]` to remove the
 SQL statement from the categorization algorithm.
 
+[discrete]
+[[ml-per-partition-categorization]]
+== Per-partition categorization
+
+If you enable per-partition categorization, categories are determined
+independently for each partition. For example, if your data includes messages
+from multiple types of logs (such as access logs and error logs), you can use a
+field like the ECS {ecs-ref}/ecs-event.html[`event.dataset` field] as the 
+`partition_field_name` and categorize the messages for each log separately.
+
+If your job has multiple detectors, every detector that uses the `mlcategory`
+keyword must also define a `partition_field_name`. You must use the same
+`partition_field_name` value in all of these detectors. Otherwise, when you
+create or update a job and enable per-partition categorization, it fails.
